help_entry.name: Mcmc
help_entry.verbose: This function performs a Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) analysis on the parameters of a model. MCMC is a numerical method that, in this program, is used to approximate the posterior probability distribution of the parameters of a model. The program takes as input a model and outputs a file containing the sampled values of the model's parameters. The fraction of the time any particular parameter value is visited by the Markov chain is a valid approximation of the parameter's posterior probability.

argument.arg_description: The statistical model to be analyzed.
The number of MCMC cycles to perform.
The frequency with which information is printed to the screen.
The frequency with which parameters of the model are sampled.
The name of the file containing the sampled parameter values.
